main event: On December 21, 1964, multiple witnesses reported seeing a large, unidentified flying object (UFO) near Harrisonburg, Virginia. The object allegedly landed briefly, showing signs of high radioactivity.
interesting points: Witnesses described the object as approximately 125 feet in diameter and 50 feet high., The object produced a Geiger counter reading indicating high radiation levels in the vicinity., Local residents experienced electrical disturbances in their vehicles during the sighting., The U.S. Air Force conducted investigations but concluded that no substantial evidence of a UFO landing was confirmed., Several reports of UFO sightings occurred in the region around the same time, suggesting a pattern of unusual aerial phenomena.
witness description: Various local residents and a professor from Eastern Mennonite College
